organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

title.gco:CharacterString: 1-Kilometer Resolution, North American Land Cover Characteristics, 1992-1993

otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: These data were downloaded from the National Atlas website (http://www.nationalatlas.gov/atlasftp.html) in August 2014.

collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States of America, 1997-2014

abstract.gco:CharacterString: This raster layer is a georeferenced grid map image of land cover characteristics for North America, excluding Hawaii, and including the Caribbean and most of Mexico. The nominal spatial resolution is 1 km and the map layer is based on 1-km AVHRR data. The data were compiled by staff at the National Center for Earth Resources Observation and Science as part of the Global Land Cover Characterization Project. The land cover classes were produced using 1-km AVHRR data from April 1992 to March 1993. The data available through the National Atlas of the United States are in GeoTIFF format. This is a revised version of the May 2002 map layer, with a corrected shoreline for Greenland. This layer is part of the 1997-2014 edition of the National Atlas of the United States.

purpose.gco:CharacterString: These data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the continental level, and for large regional areas. The data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:2,000,000-scale data. No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of these data.

credit.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey. (2002). 1-Kilometer Resolution, North American Land Cover Characteristics, 1992-1993. USGS. Available at: http://purl.stanford.edu/gk628xr0233.

useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Geological Survey regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of these data.

title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States of America, 1997-2014

environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: Documentation and the original data are available at http://edcsns17.cr.usgs.gov/glcc/

measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: No tests for logical consistency have been performed on this map layer.
This map layer contains data for all of North America, except for Hawaii, the eastern part of Greenland, southern Mexico, and Central America.

description.gco:CharacterString: The Land Cover image was downloaded from the EROS site http://edcsns17.cr.usgs.gov/glcc/glcc_version1.html#NorthAmerica. A header file was created from the information provided in the North America Documentation file located at http://edcsns17.cr.usgs.gov/glcc/nadoc1_2.html The header file consisted of the following parameters: >nrows 8996 >ncols 9223 >nbands 1 >nbits 8 >layout BIL >xdim 1000.0 >ydim 1000.0 >ulxmap -4487000.0 >ulymap 4480000.0 The data were converted from image format to ESRI GRID format using the command IMAGEGRID. The file was then reprojected to change the latitude of projection center from 50 degress to 45 degrees. A shoreline mask was created using the file shorelp020l. It was used to add land areas not included in the Land Cover map, including some Aleutian islands, Hawaii, eastern Russia, Iceland, and half of Greenland. These land areas were given a code of 255. The image was truncated to cover the same area as shorelp020l, and the resulting file was converted to TIFF format using the RGB colors listed in the Supplemental_Information section.
A GeoTIFF Revision 1.0 header was added and PackBits compression was applied to the image.

Image data for Greenland were adjusted and remasked to correct for geometric distortion in the northwest part of the island between the Robeson Channel and Cape Morris Jesup, and to improve registration with a new, corrected coastline derived from World Vector Shoreline (WVS). A link coverage was created in ArcEdit containing links between the original Greenland data and the new coastline. The link coverage was used in the Arc Adjust command to perform a linear transformation with nearest neighbor resampling on the original image, stored as an Arc/INFO grid dataset. The resulting image is geometrically correct and fits the WVS coastline. This correction was applied to data for Greenland only; the rest of the image was left unchanged.

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Center for Earth Resources Observation and Science, U.S. Geological Survey

description.gco:CharacterString: Land cover information for Canada, lower 48 United States, and Mexico.

title.gco:CharacterString: Global Land Cover Characteristics map of seasonal land cover regions for North America, version 1.2L

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Center for Earth Resources Observation and Science

otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: The procedures used in development of this map are described in Loveland, T.R., Reed, B.C., Brown, J.F., Ohlen, D.O., Zhu, J., Yang, L., and Merchant, J.W., 2000. Development of a Global Land Cover Characteristics Database and IGBP DISCover from 1-km AVHRR Data. International Journal of Remote Sensing, v. 21, no. 6/7, p. 1,303-1,330.
